reasoning: Mesenchymal chondrosarcoma is a very rare subtype of chondrosarcoma, typically occurring in young patients. Estimated <0.5 per million (approximately <0.005 per 100k) based on sarcoma registries and case series. Childhood variant represents only a fraction of total cases.
source: Bovee JVMG et al. (2010). Chondrosarcoma. In: Pathology and Genetics of Tumours of Soft Tissue and Bone. WHO Classification of Tumours. IARC Press.
